title: valsy
author: valsy
content: I have about $600 and would like to know the best graphics card I can find for that money

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: The best graphics card that I know about is Nvidia. Probably this site can be helpful for you: https://www.techradar.com/news/computing-components/graphics-cards/best-graphics-cards-1291458Know that graphics card are also slightly expensive. For bitcoin mining? Use ASIC. I know of Antminers if you want to go for ASIC. ASIC can only be used for mining, take note of that. Buying graphics card for bitcoin mining won't be profitable.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: valsy on April 03, 2023, 03:50:00 PMI have about $600 and would like to know the best graphics card I can find for that moneyIf you have just 100 dollars more you can get a pretty decent used Rtx 3090 and with the money you have you can get a Rtx 3080 I think which is the second best card of the series 3000 (not counting the 3080 ti which came later and is in the same league as 3090).If you are asking for mining 3090 and also 3080 are great cards too,the only problem is that now we are in that crypto winter or bear market as everybody else calls it and the profits are not that good.With just one such card in your home PC if your PSU accepts it,you can try mining before venturing further,you can keep the card to play games and do other activities during the day and try mining at night,you would get an idea.With that money though,3080 is the best option or you can buy 2 x Rtx 2080 ti which gives you the same hash rate as the 3090.Lots of choices now that the prices of video cards are down.

comments.author: Lafu
comments.body: Quote from: valsy on April 03, 2023, 03:50:00 PMI have about $600 and would like to know the best graphics card I can find for that moneyI agree with Oshosondy that Nvidia is the best brand for a graphics card in my opinion , but others maybe think difference about it.The one want AMD and the others want Nvidia more but it also depends what you want to do with it.If you only want to do mining or do you want to play with it also Videogames.One GPU for mining dosnt bring you a profit fast , keep that in mind.

comments.author: safar1980
comments.body: Quote from: valsy on April 03, 2023, 03:50:00 PMI have about $600 and would like to know the best graphics card I can find for that moneywait for RTX 4070 salesThe RTX 4070 price is officially $599, and it is unlikely to change. This is the same price as the RTX 3070 Ti, but that is still a $100 increase compared to the last-gen non-Ti SKU. For this, gamers will get 4GB more memory, newer RT and Tensor cores, support for DLSS3 tech and more advanced video encoding (AV1).Maybe you can buy it for $600.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: valsy on April 03, 2023, 03:50:00 PMI have about $600 and would like to know the best graphics card I can find for that moneyI also think that if you want to buy a video card for mining and use it during the 3 year warranty period, then it is better to buy 4000 series, but not hot video cards. My observation about the hashrate on new coins in this post.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5447543.msg62038432#msg62038432But do not rush to buy, wait for the reviews.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: @valsy, it would be much better if you could give more details, such as the country you are going to buy it from or your goal with the gpu.I will assume that you are from the US by showing the dollar value, and that it is for mining since you are in the mining forum.My choice with that value would be the 4070 that will launch in a few days, April 13 to be exact, and at the current time will not be difficult to buy the card at launch.The MSRP is 599The reason for choosing the Nvidia is that it would be better for mining more algos and possibly even dual or tri mining, in this aspect Nvidias are better.And a brand new card with a 2 or 3 year warranty is very good to get peace of mind with your investment.If you want to play some games, 4070 will be a good choice too.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: I would not be in a hurry to buy this graphics card on April 13th. It is not known which manufacturer's model will be better for mining. If you buy a video card with bad thermal pads, you will have to change them yourself and you may void your warranty. There is no big profit now, it is better to wait for the reviews of other miners.

comments.author: socks435
comments.body: There are many tools that you can use to find the best graphics card you can try this one https://2cryptocalc.com/most-profitable-nvidia-gpu If you are lucky go to eBay or Alibaba 2nd hand GPU still make you profit than looking for best but expensive GPUs. If you have cheap power rate 2nd hand Nvidia GPUs is the best option just learn how to maintain them well.

comments.author: deedeeranged
comments.body: Assuming you are going also to use the videocard for gaming and not for mining only.Depending if you are playing videogames on 1440p or 4k get a videocard with at least 12GB VRAM or higher so it will last you longer as newer games start to use more than 8GB of VRAM.Another thing is your preference for better RT and DLSS go with Nvidia otherwise AMD have their options for RT and FSR and FSR can be used with Nvidia/AMD and Intel videocards.For mining 8GB VRAM and above is ok and depending what coin you want to mine you can take either Nvidia or AMD.Good YT site for giving you an insight for gaming:https://www.youtube.com/@danielowentech/videosFor mining and comparison between AMD and Nvidia:https://www.youtube.com/@KiwiCryptoMiner/videosJust some ideas for you to ponder on.

comments.author: CryptoGrizzly
comments.body: It also depends on what you want to mine. I usually mine coins that use ETHASH.I'm running a few 3060 TI Founders Edition GPUs and get good results. Uses less electricity than the LHR versions.For example for ETHASH it uses 119 Watts and get 60 MH/S while my 3060 TI LHR uses 159 Watts to get the same hash rate.You can pick them up for $399 each new when available.I also like EVGA's 3060. It uses 100 Watts and get about 50 MH/S.
